node.text: Kendren! Kendren! Tell us a story of the world outside when Grand-Doe is not listening!~ Um. Live and drink, kendren.~ Is it true that all kendren kill one another for sport?~ Is it true that you kendren eat your dead?~ Is it true that there are bears covered in quills to the east?~ Is it true that bears live to be a thousand years old?~ Is it true that boars can shoot fire?~ Is it true that kendren can't fall in love?~ Is it true that kendren elders grow eyes upon their hands?~ Is it true that kendren pay for goods with crayons rather than water?~ Is it true that kendren worship rocks?~ Is it true that kendren spend hours looking at slabs of wood?~ Is it true that nine out of ten kendren cannot speak or understand language?~ Is it true that instead of dying, kendren are frozen in tubes?~ Is it true that kendren children are thrown out of the nest right after being born?~ Is it true that all kendren say 'quetzal' when they are happy?~ Is it true that kendren chefs can fry water?~ Is it true that kendren all live far underground?~ Is it true that kendren live in great bubbles?~ Is it true that kendren sleep in a snarcomfagus?~ Is there really a King of the Moon, kendren?~ I heard from my friend who heard it from their yma that the Grand-Doe says that hindren who leave Bey Lah grow an extra pair of arms. And the Grand-Doe says it so you know it's true.~ Is it true that when kendren eat mah lah soup, they explode?!~ Is it true that... um, oh. I forgot.~ Is it true that kendren don't have to ask permission to do the water ritual?~ Is it true that you don't have a Grand-Doe?~ How do kendren stay safe when you don't have a Grand-Doe to protect you?~ Um, kendren, does the yempuris phi really exist? Is it really coming to get us?~ Do you have glotrot? Do you have ironshank? Do you have funglefection? Have you ever had them? Is it gross? Can I see?~ Is it true that kendren sometimes die of cooking too hard?~ Kendren! Kendren! Take me with you! I want to see the Sixty Stilts!
node.choice: I am busy. Live and drink, little one.
